name: Printing Press
use: Revolutionized communication and spread of knowledge
creator: Johannes Gutenberg

name: Steam Engine
use: Powered the Industrial Revolution and transformed transport
creator: James Watt

name: Electricity
use: Enabled modern technology  lighting  and industrial power
creator: Thomas Edison

name: Telephone
use: Allowed real-time voice communication over distance
creator: Alexander Graham Bell

name: Automobile
use: Revolutionized personal transportation and mobility
creator: Karl Benz

name: Airplane
use: Enabled air travel and transformed global connectivity
creator: Wright Brothers (Orville Wright and Wilbur Wright)

name: Internet
use: Connected the world digitally and transformed communication
creator: ARPANET Team (Multiple Scientists including Larry Roberts, Bob Taylor, Leonard Kleinrock)

name: Computer
use: Automated calculations and enabled digital revolution
creator: Charles Babbage

name: Penicillin
use: First antibiotic that saved millions from bacterial infections
creator: Alexander Fleming

name: Light Bulb
use: Extended productive hours and illuminated the modern world
creator: Thomas Edison (improved existing designs)

name: Compass
use: Enabled navigation and global exploration
creator: Ancient Chinese

name: Paper
use: Allowed recording and sharing of written knowledge
creator: Cai Lun

name: Gunpowder
use: Changed warfare and enabled fireworks and mining
creator: Ancient Chinese Alchemists

name: Telescope
use: Enabled astronomical discoveries and space exploration
creator: Hans Lippershey

name: Microscope
use: Revealed microscopic world and advanced medicine
creator: Zacharias Janssen / Antoni van Leeuwenhoek

name: Refrigerator
use: Preserved food and revolutionized food storage
creator: James Harrison / Carl von Linde

name: Television
use: Revolutionized communication and transformed home entertainment by transmitting visual images and audio
creator: John Logie Baird (Scotland) and Philo T. Farnsworth (USA)

name: Radio
use: Revolutionized wireless communication and enabled the spread of knowledge across vast distances
creator: Guglielmo Marconi

name: Transistor
use: Enabled modern electronics by amplifying and switching electronic signals, replacing vacuum tubes
creator: John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and William Shockley

name: Smartphone
use: Enabled portable wireless communication and revolutionized how people connect globally
creator: Martin Cooper

name: GPS (Global Positioning System)
use: Enabled precise location tracking and navigation worldwide using satellite technology
creator: Roger Easton, Ivan Getting, and Bradford Parkinson

name: Camera
use: Captured and preserved visual images, revolutionizing art, science, and documentation
creator: Joseph Nicéphore Niépce

name: X-Ray
use: Revealed the internal structure of objects and revolutionized medical diagnosis
creator: Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen

name: Anesthesia
use: Enabled painless surgery by blocking pain sensation during medical procedures
creator: Crawford Williamson Long and William T.G. Morton

name: Vaccines
use: Prevented infectious diseases by stimulating the immune system to develop immunity
creator: Edward Jenner (vaccination) and Louis Pasteur (vaccines)

name: Laser
use: Produced monochromatic coherent light for applications in medicine, industry, and communications
creator: Theodore Maiman

name: Plastic
use: Created versatile synthetic material for countless applications in manufacturing and daily life
creator: Leo Baekeland

name: Concrete(portland cement)
use: Provided strong, durable building material for construction and infrastructure
creator: joseph Aspdin

name: Steel
use: Enabled mass production of strong, affordable metal for construction and manufacturing
creator: Henry Bessemer

name: Plow(steel plow)
use: Revolutionized agriculture by enabling efficient tilling of heavy prairie soil
creator: John Deere

name: Rocket
use: Enabled space exploration and atmospheric research through propulsion technology
creator: Robert H. Goddard (liquid-fuel rocket) and Wernher von Braun (modern rocketry)

name: Nuclear Energy
use: Harnessed controlled nuclear chain reactions for power generation and other applications
creator: Enrico Fermi

name: MRI Scanner
use: Revolutionized medical diagnostics by producing highly detailed images of internal body structures without invasive procedures or harmful radiation
creator: Raymond Damadian, Paul Lauterbur, and Peter Mansfield

name: DNA Structure Discovery
use: Revealed the double helix structure of DNA, enabling understanding of heredity, genetics, and the mechanisms of life
creator: James Watson, Francis Crick, Rosalind Franklin, and Maurice Wilkins

name: Semiconductor (Integrated Circuit)
use: Enabled modern electronics by integrating multiple electronic components (transistors, resistors, capacitors) onto a single semiconductor chip
creator: Jack Kilby and Robert Noyce

name: Fiber Optics
use: Enabled high-speed data transmission over long distances using light through glass fibers for telecommunications and internet communications
creator: Charles K. Kao

name: Battery(Electric)
use: Provided the first continuous and reproducible source of electrical current, revolutionizing the study and application of electricity
creator: Alessandro Volta

name: Air conditioning
use: Enabled precise climate control in buildings by cooling and dehumidifying air, transforming indoor environments and making hot climates habitable
creator: Willis Haviland Carrier

name: Elevator (Safety Elevator)
use: Enabled safe vertical transportation in buildings, making skyscrapers and high-rise construction feasible
creator: Elisha Graves Otis

name: Credit Card
use: Revolutionized payment systems by allowing consumers to make purchases without cash and defer payment
creator: Frank McNamara

name: Barcode
use: Enabled automatic product identification and tracking, revolutionizing retail checkout and global commerce
creator: Norman Joseph Woodland and Bernard Silver

name: Microwave Oven
use: Revolutionized cooking by using microwave radiation to heat food quickly and efficiently
creator: Percy Spencer

name: Solar Panel (Solar Cell)
use: Converted sunlight directly into electricity using the photovoltaic effect, enabling renewable solar energy
creator: Charles Fritts

name: Satellite (Artificial Satellite)
use: Enabled space-based communications, observations, navigation, and scientific research
creator: Sergei Korolev (chief designer of Sputnik 1)

name: CT Scanner
use: Revolutionized medical diagnostics by creating detailed three-dimensional cross-sectional images of internal body structures
creator: Godfrey Hounsfield and Allan Cormack

name: World Wide Web
use: Created a global information system connecting documents through hyperlinks on the Internet, transforming how information is shared
creator: Tim Berners-Lee

name: Mechanical Clock
use: Revolutionized timekeeping by using weight-driven mechanism and escapement system to accurately track time in all environmental conditions
creator: European inventors (13th-14th century)

name: Eyeglasses (Spectacles)
use: Corrected vision impairments by using convex or concave lenses, allowing people to see clearly and enabling literacy among the aging population
creator: Italian inventors (13th century), possibly Salvino D'Armati

name: Sewing Machine
use: Revolutionized the textile industry by mechanizing the process of stitching fabric, dramatically increasing production speed and making clothing affordable
creator: Elias Howe,issac singer

name: Dynamite
use: Made construction safer and more efficient by providing a stable, manageable explosive for mining, railroad building, tunnel construction, and other infrastructure projects
creator: Alfred Nobel

name: Parachute
use: Enabled safe descent from height by creating atmospheric drag to slow fall, making high-altitude aviation and emergency exits possible
creator: Louis-Sébastien Lenormand,André-Jacques Garnerin

name: Pneumatic Tire (Air-Filled Tire)
use: Revolutionized transportation by providing cushioned, air-filled tires that dramatically improved comfort and performance for bicycles and automobiles
creator: John Boyd Dunlop

name: Ballpoint Pen
use: Reliable ink delivery for writing.
creator: László Bíró

name: Zipper
use: Fast and secure fastening for clothing.
creator: Gideon Sundback

name: Velcro
use: Hook-and-loop fastener for textiles.
creator: George de Mestral

name: Nylon
use: Synthetic fiber used for textiles and plastics.
creator: Wallace Carothers

name: Safety Pin
use: Simple and safe fastening pin.
creator: Walter Hunt

name: Sewing Machine
use: Mechanized stitching for garments.
creator: Elias Howe (improved)

name: Refrigerator (Domestic)
use: Preserve food by cooling.
creator: Multiple inventors (modern compressor)

name: Microwave Oven
use: Rapid cooking using microwaves.
creator: Percy Spencer

name: Air Conditioning
use: Control indoor temperature and humidity.
creator: Willis Carrier

name: Camera (Photographic)
use: Capture still images.
creator: Nicéphore Niépce / Daguerre (early)

name: Telescope (Refracting)
use: Magnify distant objects.
creator: Hans Lippershey (credited)

name: Microscope (Compound)
use: Magnify tiny objects and organisms.
creator: Zacharias Janssen (credited)

name: Penicillin (Discovery)
use: Antibiotic to treat bacterial infections.
creator: Alexander Fleming

name: Vaccination (Smallpox)
use: Prevent infectious disease by immunity.
creator: Edward Jenner

name: Anesthesia (Modern)
use: Pain control in surgery.
creator: Crawford Long / William Morton

name: Radar
use: Detect objects using radio waves.
creator: Multiple (RADAR development)

name: Jet Engine
use: High-speed air propulsion for aircraft.
creator: Frank Whittle / Hans von Ohain

name: Helicopter
use: Vertical takeoff and landing aircraft.
creator: Igor Sikorsky (modern)

name: Submarine (Modern)
use: Underwater vehicle for transport and research.
creator: John Philip Holland (modern)

name: Radar (Doppler)
use: Measure velocity and position using Doppler effect.
creator: Multiple inventors

name: Electric Motor
use: Convert electrical energy to mechanical rotation.
creator: Michael Faraday / Joseph Henry (early)

name: Battery (Rechargeable)
use: Store electrical energy for reuse.
creator: Alessandro Volta (early)/Gaston Planté (lead-acid)

name: Lithium-ion Battery
use: High energy-density rechargeable battery.
creator: John Goodenough / Akira Yoshino

name: Solar Cell (Photovoltaic)
use: Convert sunlight to electricity.
creator: Bell Labs (modern silicon cell)

name: Wind Turbine (Modern)
use: Generate electricity from wind.
creator: Modern turbine developers

name: Fuel Cell
use: Convert chemical energy into electricity.
creator: Sir William Grove

name: Transistor
use: Semiconductor device for amplification/switching.
creator: John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, William Shockley

name: Integrated Circuit
use: Miniaturized electronic circuits on a chip.
creator: Jack Kilby / Robert Noyce

name: Microprocessor
use: CPU on a single chip enabling personal computers.
creator: Intel team (e.g., Ted Hoff, Federico Faggin)

name: Personal Computer
use: Computing device for individual use.
creator: Multiple (Altair/Apple/IBM pioneers)

name: Internet (ARPANET)
use: Global packet-switched network for communication.
creator: Vint Cerf, Bob Kahn and ARPA contributors

name: World Wide Web
use: Hyperlinked information system on the internet.
creator: Tim Berners-Lee

name: GPS (Global Positioning System)
use: Satellite navigation for positioning and timing.
creator: U.S. Department of Defense engineers

name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)
use: Medical imaging using magnetic fields.
creator: Raymond Damadian / Paul Lauterbur (development)

name: Laser
use: Coherent light source for cutting, medicine, communication.
creator: Theodore Maiman (first laser)

name: CCD Image Sensor
use: Electronic imaging sensor for cameras.
creator: Willard Boyle & George E. Smith

name: Photocopier (Xerography)
use: Copy documents using dry copying process.
creator: Chester Carlson

name: Fax Machine
use: Transmit scanned documents over telephone lines.
creator: Alexander Bain / later developers

name: QR Code
use: Matrix barcode for quick data scanning.
creator: Denso Wave

name: 3D Printing (Additive Manufacturing)
use: Build 3D objects layer by layer.
creator: Chuck Hull (stereolithography)

name: Lithography (Semiconductor)
use: Pattern circuits onto silicon wafers.
creator: Modern semiconductor industry

name: Optical Fiber
use: High-speed light-based data transmission.
creator: Charles Kao (pioneer)

name: GPS Receiver (Consumer)
use: Portable device to use GPS signals for navigation.
creator: Multiple innovators

name: Bluetooth
use: Short-range wireless communication technology.
creator: Ericsson team

name: Touchscreen
use: Directly interact with displays by touch.
creator: E.A. Johnson / earlier researchers

name: Drone
use: Enabled aerial photography, surveillance, delivery systems, and agricultural monitoring through remote or autonomous flight
creator: Abraham Karem (modern drone pioneer)

name: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
use: Enabled machines to perform tasks requiring human-like intelligence such as decision-making, learning, speech, and image recognition.
creator: John McCarthy (coined the term “Artificial Intelligence”)
